author: Sam K

text:
Though I'm a huge Mario fan, I never had an SNES. One summer we visited my Mom's friend for a 1 week. I discovered 3 things: 1 She had Super Mario World. 2 The PREMIERE of Cartoon Network. 3 I was super allergic to cats. In 1 day one of my eyes swelled shut. I could hardly breathe, and I ITCHED.

When my sister was awake, we watched Cartoon Network and LOVED it. When the TV was free I played the HECK outta Super Mario World beating it 100% Bonus levels too! All with my one good eye! In one week!

author: purplevinca

text: If I ever have kids, I know that they're going to grow up playing video games.  And I'll be damned if they end up becomming those whiny kids playing FPS all day on Xbox and raging and crying over little things.  I want them to grow up playing awesome shit like this.  I guess all I'm saying is that I want them to have an awesome childhood like I did.  Retro gaming is special in some sort of way, a charm that today's modern games don't have.
author: Guitarboredguy

text: This game is an anthem to simplicity. Gameplay is simple, graphics are simple, music is simple. That's makes it a true masterpiece.

author: JFK piano

text:
At the conclusion of a long journey, Mario returns home recalling all the adventures that he had along the way. The path was long and hard, and there were some good moments and some frustrating moments. Slowly the curtain draws and so ends the long adventure and also the end of an era in gaming. 

This is my #1 favorite videogame song of all time.
